bigfive.title: Big Five Personality
bigfive.description: The scientifically validated Big Five model measures your personality across five key dimensions: Openness to new experiences, Conscientiousness in organization and responsibility, Extraversion in social energy, Agreeableness in interpersonal warmth, and Neuroticism in emotional stability. These traits provide deep insights into your behavior patterns, preferences, and natural tendencies.

questions.e1: I am the life of the party
questions.e5: I talk to many different people at parties
questions.a2: I am not interested in other people's problems
questions.a4: I take time out for others
questions.a5: I feel little concern for others
questions.c4: I make a mess of things
questions.c5: I get chores done right away
questions.n2: I am relaxed most of the time
questions.o2: I have difficulty understanding abstract ideas
questions.o4: I am interested in many things
questions.o5: I do not have a good imagination

enneagram.title: Enneagram Type
enneagram.description: Discover your core motivation and personality type through comprehensive assessment

questions.q1: When facing a challenging situation, your first instinct is to:
questions.q3: When you feel stressed, you are most likely to:
questions.q4: Your greatest strength is probably your:
questions.q6: At work or in groups, you typically:
questions.q7: When making decisions, you rely most on:
questions.q10: When conflict arises, you tend to:
questions.q16: When helping others, you prefer to:
questions.q17: Your relationship with rules and structure is:

options.q1_a: Focus on doing the right thing and maintaining standards
options.q1_b: Make sure everyone is okay and offer support
options.q1_c: Take charge and find the most efficient solution
options.q2_a: Put others' needs before your own
options.q2_c: Maintain some emotional distance to stay secure
options.q3_a: Seek new experiences and stay optimistic
options.q3_c: Withdraw and need time alone to think
options.q6_b: Support the team and maintain relationships
options.q6_c: Stay flexible and keep options open
options.q7_a: Your principles and what feels right
options.q10_c: Avoid it if possible and seek peace
options.q12_a: Enjoy meeting new people and sharing experiences
options.q12_c: Adapt to what the situation requires
options.q13_a: Embrace it as an opportunity for improvement
options.q13_c: Go with the flow and adapt as needed
options.q14_a: Listen carefully and try to improve
options.q14_b: Feel hurt but try to understand the perspective
options.q15_a: Lead by example and maintain high standards
options.q15_c: Build consensus and keep everyone happy
options.q16_a: Give them tools to help themselves
options.q16_c: Stay out of their way unless asked
options.q17_a: You appreciate clear guidelines and structure
options.q17_b: You work well within reasonable boundaries
options.q17_c: You prefer flexibility and minimal restrictions
options.q18_a: The pursuit of security and safety
options.q18_b: The desire for fun and stimulation
options.q18_c: The need for justice and control

results.type1: The Perfectionist - You strive for integrity and improvement, with a strong sense of right and wrong.
results.type2: The Helper - You are caring and generous, focused on meeting others' needs.
results.type3: The Achiever - You are success-oriented and driven, adaptable and ambitious.
results.type4: The Individualist - You are creative and introspective, seeking authenticity and meaning.
results.type5: The Investigator - You are perceptive and independent, innovative and secretive.
results.type6: The Loyalist - You are responsible and committed, anxious and suspicious.
results.type7: The Enthusiast - You are spontaneous and versatile, scattered and undisciplined.
results.type8: The Challenger - You are self-confident and decisive, confrontational and intimidating.
results.type9: The Peacemaker - You are receptive and reassuring, complacent and resigned.

feedback360.title: 360Â° Feedback Assessment
feedback360.description: Get comprehensive feedback from friends, family, colleagues, and classmates through category-specific questionnaires.

ui.title: Feedback Request
ui.instructions: Please answer the following questions honestly. Your responses will be kept completely anonymous.
ui.submitted_message: Your feedback for {name} has been successfully submitted.
ui.submitted_description: {name} will receive your insights while your identity remains completely anonymous.

universal.q1: Does this person manage emotions well and stay calm under stress or pressure?
universal.q2: How well does this person adapt to new situations or unexpected changes?
universal.q3: Does this person work consistently toward goals and manage themselves well?
universal.q4: Does this person enjoy socializing and gain energy from social situations?
universal.q5: How open and curious is this person about new ideas or experiences?
universal.q6: Does this person understand and empathize with others' emotions and perspectives?
universal.q7: Does this person express thoughts and feelings clearly and effectively?
universal.q8: Does this person try to resolve conflicts constructively?
universal.q9: How trustworthy is this person, and do they keep their promises?
universal.q10: Does this person try to help others and show consideration?

work.q11: Does this person take initiative or leadership roles in work projects or team activities?
work.q12: Does this person approach work decisions logically and systematically?
work.q13: Does this person collaborate with colleagues to achieve team goals?
work.q14: Does this person accept work-related feedback and try to improve?
work.q15: Does this person suggest innovative ideas or solutions in the workplace?
work.q16: Does this person manage work stress and deadline pressure well?
work.q17: Does this person try to provide help or support to colleagues?
work.q18: Does this person communicate their opinions effectively in work meetings or presentations?
work.q19: Does this person fulfill work-related commitments and responsibilities reliably?
work.q20: Does this person show interest and effort in professional growth and learning?

friends.q11: Does this person lead group atmosphere or suggest activities in friend gatherings?
friends.q12: Does this person listen to friends' problems and offer advice?
friends.q13: Does this person keep promises with friends and can be trusted?
friends.q14: Does this person create fun and enjoyable atmosphere when with friends?
friends.q15: Does this person genuinely celebrate friends' success or good news?
friends.q16: Does this person try to provide practical help when friends are in difficulty?
friends.q17: Does this person make the first effort to reconcile when conflicts arise with friends?
friends.q18: Does this person respect friends' various opinions or choices?
friends.q19: Does this person like to have deep conversations with friends?
friends.q20: Does this person maintain and cherish long-term friendships?

family.q11: Does this person actively participate when making important family decisions?
family.q12: Does this person understand and consider family members' emotions and needs well?
family.q13: Does this person participate in planning and preparing family events or gatherings?
family.q14: Does this person contribute constructively to resolving family conflicts or problems?
family.q15: Does this person maintain regular communication and contact with family members?
family.q16: Does this person respect and try to continue family traditions or values?
family.q17: Does this person prioritize helping family members when they are in difficulty?
family.q18: Does this person contribute to creating a positive and warm atmosphere within the family?
family.q19: Does this person support family members' personal growth and goals?
family.q20: Does this person act with responsibility and dedication toward the family?

academic.q11: Does this person take leadership roles in academic group projects or study groups?
academic.q12: Does this person set learning goals and study systematically?
academic.q13: Does this person try to share knowledge or information with fellow students?
academic.q14: Does this person actively utilize feedback from professors or teachers?
academic.q15: Does this person try new methods or approaches related to academics?
academic.q16: Does this person manage academic stress such as exams or presentations well?
academic.q17: Does this person try to help fellow students who are having academic difficulties?
academic.q18: Does this person actively ask questions and participate in classes or seminars?
academic.q19: Does this person complete assignments or exam preparation diligently and thoroughly?
academic.q20: Does this person show deep interest and passion for their major field?

general.q11: Does this person act confidently in general social situations?
general.q12: Does this person find practical and effective solutions in problem situations?
general.q13: Does this person demonstrate teamwork when working or doing activities with others?
general.q14: Does this person acknowledge their mistakes or shortcomings and try to improve?
general.q15: Does this person present creative and original ideas or perspectives?
general.q16: Does this person respond calmly to unexpected situations or crises?
general.q17: Does this person willingly take time to help others when they need assistance?
general.q18: Does this person communicate with respect for the other party when expressing opinions?
general.q19: Does this person act with responsibility toward their promises or words?
general.q20: Does this person maintain an overall positive and hopeful attitude?

ui.title: Feedback Request
ui.instructions: Please answer the following questions about them honestly. Your responses will remain anonymous.
ui.think_about: Think about {name} when answering this question.
ui.anonymous_notice: This feedback is completely anonymous. {name} will see aggregated results but not individual responses or who provided them.
ui.submitted_message: Your feedback about {name} has been submitted successfully.
ui.submitted_description: {name} will be notified that you've provided feedback. Your responses will remain anonymous and help them gain valuable insights about their personality and behavior.

couple.title: ðŸ’• Couple Compatibility Test
couple.description: Discover how compatible you and your partner are! Take this fun test first, then send an invitation to your partner. You'll both get a percentage-based compatibility score with fun descriptions and shareable results.
couple.waiting_description: Your compatibility results will be available once your partner completes their test. We'll compare your answers across 15 key relationship areas to calculate your compatibility percentage.
couple.invitation_sent: Invitation sent! Your partner will receive an email to complete their part of the test.

questions.q6: What matters most in a relationship?
questions.q9: How much time together vs apart?
questions.q10: What do you value most in a partner?

general_knowledge.title: General Knowledge Challenge
general_knowledge.description: Test your knowledge across various topics with this rotating trivia challenge that updates weekly.

questions.q1: Where is the ancient city of Petra located?
questions.q2: Which planet is the brightest in our night sky?
questions.q4: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.q6: What is the most abundant element in the universe?
questions.q7: In what year did the Titanic sink?
questions.q8: What is the longest river in the world?
questions.q9: Who developed the theory of relativity?
questions.q10: Which continent is the largest by area?
questions.q11: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
questions.q12: How many bones are in an adult human body?
questions.q13: What is the fastest land animal?
questions.q14: What gas makes up about 78% of Earth's atmosphere?
questions.q15: How many hearts does an octopus have?
questions.q16: In what year did World War II end?
questions.q17: Who was the first person to walk on the moon?
questions.q18: Which wonder of the ancient world was located in Alexandria?
questions.q19: In what year did the Berlin Wall fall?
questions.q20: Who was the first Roman Emperor?

questions.q5: What is the square root of 64?

memory_power.description: Challenge your memory with pattern recognition and sequence recall. How sharp is your mind?
